doc:
Kay Deslys https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kay_Deslys 0 Kay Deslys (28 September 1899, in London – 15 August 1974 in West Covina, California) was an English comedy actress, based in the United States from the 1920s on. Born as Kathleen Herbert in London, one of her earliest roles was in Charlie Chaplin's celebrated feature The Gold Rush; she later appeared in several comedies at the Hal Roach Studios, including several early Laurel and Hardy comedies. During the 1930s and 1940s, she played mainly bit and extra roles in feature films before retiring in the early 1950s. She died of congestive heart failure and a stroke in West Covina, Los Angeles County, California, aged 74. Kay_Deslys ( 28_September_1899 , in London – 15_August_1974 in West_Covina , California ) was an_English_comedy_actress , based in the_United_States from the_1920s on . Born as Kathleen_Herbert in London , one of her_earliest_roles was in Charlie_Chaplin 's_celebrated_feature The_Gold_Rush ; she later appeared in several_comedies at the_Hal_Roach_Studios , including several_early_Laurel_and_Hardy_comedies . During the_1930s_and_1940s , she played mainly bit_and_extra_roles in feature_films before retiring in the_early_1950s . She died of congestive_heart_failure and a_stroke in West_Covina , Los_Angeles_County , California , aged_74 .
